result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Eric M Schmidt
Current: 540 S 3rd Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2017)
Prior: 1134 Meridian Street, Curtiss, WI 54422

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:13 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF937 AND 15CM2439. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Amanda Ley. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM2439: Ct. 1 (Theft/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF937: Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with Granite Valley Forest Products, S.D., G.B., and M.D.; pay $405.09 restitution to S.D. at a rate of at least $10 per month until paid in full; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 106 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 3:27 pm

No contact with victim(s):  Granite Valley Forest Products, G.B., S.D., M.D. and co-deft; P.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
